reviews.subject: Behavioral Operations Management
reviews.review: Professor Cantor's classes are highly engaging. His real-world examples from motor carrier safety make complex concepts accessible and relevant.

reviews.subject: International Logistics
reviews.review: Dr. Chen's lectures are comprehensive and provide a global perspective on supply chain management. His teaching style is particularly praised by students.

reviews.subject: Process Analysis
reviews.review: Professor Denizel's hands-on approach to teaching process analysis is highly valued. Her courses offer practical insights directly applicable to industry challenges.

reviews.subject: Sustainability in Supply Chains
reviews.review: Dr. Montabon's courses are transformative. He inspires critical thinking about the future of manufacturing by connecting environmental responsibility with business practices.

reviews.subject: Supply Chain Collaboration
reviews.review: Professor Ralston's teaching is highly regarded. He incorporates research on factor-market rivalry into discussions, providing a strategic perspective on supply chain decisions.
research: A firm's strategic decision to be a part of a supply chain

reviews.subject: Urban Logistics
reviews.review: Dr. Rose's courses on urban logistics and last-mile delivery are popular. His use of simulation modeling in teaching vehicle routing problems is both innovative and practical.

reviews.subject: Supply Chain Blockchain
reviews.review: Professor Sternberg's classes on supply chain blockchain technology are cutting-edge. He excels at explaining complex technological concepts and their applications in supply chain transportation.

reviews.subject: Logistics Decision Support Systems
reviews.review: Dr. Suzuki's teaching is highly praised. Students find his courses on fuel optimization and vehicle routing particularly valuable, appreciating the blend of theoretical knowledge and practical application.
